model_answer:
The correct chronology is: 
(1) Breakfast is cooked while a voice says, “Lions take a seven-oh lead.”
(2) TV shows Falcons–Lions tied 14–14 in the 3rd quarter.
(3) TV shows Steelers–Titans at 27–24 with 2:40 left; the viewer frets about the game.
(4) Someone yells “He shank it!” and brags about a Steelers + over parlay on a betting screen.
(5) With 0:03 left at 22–16, a last-second TD ties it 22–22 amid “4% win” taunts.
(6) After the 22–22 tie, there’s a flag discussion and someone says Gurley should’ve kneeled.

Therefore, the correct order is option B: 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6.

The correct chronology of the events is: (1) A ad and morning coffee scene featuring grinder noise, joking “coffeffi,” and a dog sound. (2) The dog barks when asked if Matt Patricia is the worst coach; a woman mentions Adam Gase. (3) The host says it’s time to bench Baker Mayfield and calls his fantasy team trash. (4) He lists injuries (e.g., Aaron Jones, Miles Sanders) while a fantasy app screen is shown. (5) During a Browns game, excited shouts about “DPJ/Peoples-Jones” accompany a touchdown. (6) He signs off, praising it as the best game in a long time and shows the “Thanks for watching” graphic.

Therefore, the answer is B: 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6.
